explanation: shows the current scene
hides the current scene
Applies a rotation to the node, in radians, starting from its current rotation.
Moves the turtle in the direction it's facing by some pixels.
Rotates the turtle to the right by some degrees.
Rotates the turtle to the left by some degrees.
Offsets the turtle's position by the given x and y amounts of pixels.
Makes the turtle draw a rectangle starting at its current position.
The position of the entity on the horizontal axis.
The position of the entity on the vertical axis.
"Applies a local translation on the node's X axis based on the [code]Node._process[/code]'s [code]delta[/code]. If [code]scaled[/code] is false
Stores how many cells make up the width ([code]board_size.x[/code]) and height ([code]board_size.y[/code]) of the board.
The cell position of the robot on the board. [code]Vector2(0, 0)[/code] is the square cell in the top left of the board.
Creates a list of numbers from [code]0[/code] to [code]length - 1[/code].
Orders the robot to play an animation.
Selects units in the cell coordinates passed as the function's argument.
Queues a move animation towards the target cell.
Adds the value passed as an argument at the back of the array.
Removes the first value from the array and returns it.
Removes the last value from the array and returns it.
Returns the argument converted into a [code]String[/code]. Works with the majority of value types.

Returns the argument converted into an [code]int[/code] (whole number) [i]if possible[/i]. Supports converting decimal numbers, strings, and booleans. Useful to convert player text input into numbers.
Creates a new unit matching the type parameter and places it at the desired cell position on the game grid.
Creates a new item and displays it in the inventory.
Increases the item count by amount.
